title.narrative: Red Cross Denmark activities in Syria and the region, 2020

description.narrative: Red Cross Denmark activities in Syria and the region, 2020 Saving lives and building resilience through multi-sector assistance to populations affected by the Syria Crisis in Syria, Lebanon and Iraq
FL §06.39.03.11 Other contributions to acute and prolonged crises

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Lebanon

A1.1: Assess patient vulnerabilities, adapt selection criteria to the evolving situation, and monitor PRCS-L health facilities costs for patients A1.2: Provide "CVA-for-health" to 1,574 vulnerable individuals through 5 PRCS-L health facilities - Direct voucher payment of patients’ medical bill at an average bill cost of USD 366

target.value: A1.1: Assess patient vulnerabilities, adapt selection criteria to the evolving situation, and monitor PRCS-L health facilities costs for patients A1.2: Provide "CVA-for-health" to 1,574 vulnerable individuals through 5 PRCS-L health facilities - Direct voucher payment of patients’ medical bill at an average bill cost of USD 366

title.narrative: Syria

A1.1: Train 100 SARC and PRCS-S health workers on disease prevention and control and medicine management A1.2: Provide quality primary health care and medicines to 130,000 vulnerable individuals through 5 SARC and 5 PRCS-S health facilities A1.3: Provide COVID-19 information, materials and referral, for staff and patients through SARC and PRCS-S health facilities

target.value: A1.1: Train 100 SARC and PRCS-S health workers on disease prevention and control and medicine management A1.2: Provide quality primary health care and medicines to 130,000 vulnerable individuals through 5 SARC and 5 PRCS-S health facilities A1.3: Provide COVID-19 information, materials and referral, for staff and patients through SARC and PRCS-S health facilities

title.narrative: Syria

A2.1: Provide basic and focused psychosocial support to 33,600 vulnerable individuals and communities through 3 SARC and 1 PRCS-S community centres, and 5 SARC and 5 PRCS-S outreach teams A2.2: Train 240 SARC and PRCS-S staff and volunteers on psychosocial support approaches/protection mainstreaming A2.3: Provide non-formal education (remedial classes, homework clubs and literacy classes) to 1,000 at-risk and out-of-school children and youth

target.value: A2.1: Provide basic and focused psychosocial support to 33,600 vulnerable individuals and communities through 3 SARC and 1 PRCS-S community centres, and 5 SARC and 5 PRCS-S outreach teams A2.2: Train 240 SARC and PRCS-S staff and volunteers on psychosocial support approaches/protection mainstreaming A2.3: Provide non-formal education (remedial classes, homework clubs and literacy classes) to 1,000 at-risk and out-of-school children and youth

title.narrative: Iraq

A2.1: Provide basic and focused psychosocial support to 4,000 vulnerable individuals and communities through IRCS teams A2.2: Train 20 IRCS staff and volunteers on psychosocial support approaches/protection mainstreaming A2.3: Provide psychosocial support to IRCS staff and volunteers A2.4: Conduct safe referrals for 250 vulnerable individuals

target.value: A2.1: Provide basic and focused psychosocial support to 4,000 vulnerable individuals and communities through IRCS teams A2.2: Train 20 IRCS staff and volunteers on psychosocial support approaches/protection mainstreaming A2.3: Provide psychosocial support to IRCS staff and volunteers A2.4: Conduct safe referrals for 250 vulnerable individuals

title.narrative: Lebanon

A2.1: Provide basic and focused psychosocial support to 6,000 vulnerable individuals and communities through LRC and PRCS-L teams A2.2: Train 60 PRCS-L and 140 LRC staff and volunteers on psychosocial support approaches/protection mainstreaming A2.3: Provide psychosocial support to LRC (EMS) staff and volunteers -Phone support line staffed by professional therapists

target.value: A2.1: Provide basic and focused psychosocial support to 6,000 vulnerable individuals and communities through LRC and PRCS-L teams A2.2: Train 60 PRCS-L and 140 LRC staff and volunteers on psychosocial support approaches/protection mainstreaming A2.3: Provide psychosocial support to LRC (EMS) staff and volunteers -Phone support line staffed by professional therapists

title.narrative: Lebanon

A3.1: Train (refresher) 35 LRC staff and volunteers on CVA A3.2: Conduct household assessments and verification of beneficiaries A3.3: Distribute MPC to 405 vulnerable households - Monthly ATM-card transfer of USD 104 for 12 months, plus two winter transfers of USD 59, this to cover only the unmet needs of the Lebanon Survival Minimum Expenditure Basket (SMEB) (estimated at USD 430) as WFP and UNHCR cover the rest of the SMEB. MPC is unrestricted and unconditional.

target.value: A3.1: Train (refresher) 35 LRC staff and volunteers on CVA A3.2: Conduct household assessments and verification of beneficiaries A3.3: Distribute MPC to 405 vulnerable households - Monthly ATM-card transfer of USD 104 for 12 months, plus two winter transfers of USD 59, this to cover only the unmet needs of the Lebanon Survival Minimum Expenditure Basket (SMEB) (estimated at USD 430) as WFP and UNHCR cover the rest of the SMEB. MPC is unrestricted and unconditional.

title.narrative: Syria

A3.1: Train 80 SARC staff and volunteers on relief/supply chain management and/or CVA A3.2: Support 4 SARC sub-branches in terms of human and operational costs in conflict affected areas of Syria (2 in Deir ez Zor, 2 in Idleb) A3.3: Distribute food (in-kind or via CVA) to 1,000 vulnerable households in conflict affected areas of Syria - Food parcel or food voucher worth approximately 255 DKK, to cover a food basked for 2 months distributed once

target.value: A3.1: Train 80 SARC staff and volunteers on relief/supply chain management and/or CVA A3.2: Support 4 SARC sub-branches in terms of human and operational costs in conflict affected areas of Syria (2 in Deir ez Zor, 2 in Idleb) A3.3: Distribute food (in-kind or via CVA) to 1,000 vulnerable households in conflict affected areas of Syria - Food parcel or food voucher worth approximately 255 DKK, to cover a food basked for 2 months distributed once

title.narrative: Iraq

A3.1: Train IRCS staff and volunteers on CVA A3.2: Conduct household assessments and verification of beneficiaries A3.3: Distribute MPC to 201 vulnerable households - Monthly direct cash transfer of USD 400 for 4 months to cover the full Iraq SMEB (estimated at 400 USD). MPC is unrestricted, and unconditional for 75% of beneficiaries. 25% of the total beneficiaries need to complete the condition of attending a PSS session.

target.value: A3.1: Train IRCS staff and volunteers on CVA A3.2: Conduct household assessments and verification of beneficiaries A3.3: Distribute MPC to 201 vulnerable households - Monthly direct cash transfer of USD 400 for 4 months to cover the full Iraq SMEB (estimated at 400 USD). MPC is unrestricted, and unconditional for 75% of beneficiaries. 25% of the total beneficiaries need to complete the condition of attending a PSS session.

title.narrative: Syria

A4.1: Provide vocational training to 440 individuals at SARC/PRCS-S community centres to enhance employability A4.2: Post-training and based on a personal business/development plan, provide assets (in-kind or via CVA) to support income generation activities - 440 vulnerable individuals will receive an asset (in-kind or cash) worth between approximately 950 - 2,500 DKK

target.value: A4.1: Provide vocational training to 440 individuals at SARC/PRCS-S community centres to enhance employability A4.2: Post-training and based on a personal business/development plan, provide assets (in-kind or via CVA) to support income generation activities - 440 vulnerable individuals will receive an asset (in-kind or cash) worth between approximately 950 - 2,500 DKK

title.narrative: Cross-Cutting Activities

AX.1: Conduct a Kick-Off Workshop with all four National Societies and DRC HQ/RO staff AX.2: AX.2: Prepare a cross-country M&E Plan, establish baseline values (if required) and coordinate on harmonised tools to use for Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (PMEAL) and ensure Quarterly Progress Reporting AX.3: Promote and organise cross-country and cross-National Society experience exchange meetings, training, and/or workshops AX.4: Mainstream - where possible - Community Engagement and Accountability (CEA) approaches across the Project together with the National Societies AX.5: Conduct a cross-country final internal review of the Project and ensure lessons learnt are documented

target.value: AX.1: Conduct a Kick-Off Workshop with all four National Societies and DRC HQ/RO staff AX.2: AX.2: Prepare a cross-country M&E Plan, establish baseline values (if required) and coordinate on harmonised tools to use for Planning, Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (PMEAL) and ensure Quarterly Progress Reporting AX.3: Promote and organise cross-country and cross-National Society experience exchange meetings, training, and/or workshops AX.4: Mainstream - where possible - Community Engagement and Accountability (CEA) approaches across the Project together with the National Societies AX.5: Conduct a cross-country final internal review of the Project and ensure lessons learnt are documented

title.narrative: Output 1: Timely and quality health care is provided to conflict-affected and most vulnerable populations
N/A
Output 2: Timely and relevant psychosocial support is delivered to vulnerable individuals and communities by well-capacitated RCRC National Societies
N/A
Output 3: Timely and relevant basic relief assistance is delivered to vulnerable individuals and communities by well-capacitated RCRC National Societies
N/A
Output 4: Improved employability skills and income for targeted vulnerable individuals
N/A
